item.title: Skibidi Toilet has made its way to Borderlands 4 just to spite its narrative director
item.content:encoded:
Borderlands 4 players on the PC are now able to download a little mod that'll add a particularly famous meme to the game, in spite of the narrative director's public woes.

That's right, the Skibidi Toilet mod can be downloaded on Nexusmods right now. This mod will add the infamous Skibidi Toilet face to in-game toilets, bringing everyone's fears to life. The mod was created by EpicNNG, developer and Borderlands content creator.

The reason this jokey mod is of note is thanks to Borderlands 4 narrative director Sam Winkler's comments on the game's tone prior to launch. On social media, Winkler said that the "toilet humour" present in Borderlands 3 would be toned down, and stated: "if the word skibidi ships in the game under my watch Iâ€™m gonna cry real tears".

So while Sam Winkler has been able to sleep peacefully knowing Borderlands 4 hasn't shipped with any especially cringeworthy gags, it seems certain corners of the Borderlands community have long memories. People say having open communication to developers is great for community building and strong ties to the folks making the experiences gamers love. The real reason is obviously this: to create mods to torment them.

It actually gets worse for Winkler, who also stated: "Paul Tassi joked that we were gonna have a gun called Hawk 2A and a fellow dev asked me if it was real and I wanted to put my hand down the sink grinder". EpicNNG posted on X that "Hawk 2A is next", so here's hoping any Borderlands 4 DLC is written up and ready to go before Winkler does something drastic.

If this has somehow convinced you to try out Borderlands 4, why not check out our Borderlands 4 review! In it reviewer Rick Lane concludes: "Borderlands 4 brings a more sensible script and a true open world to its pseudo-cel-shaded gun-show. But these moderate improvements are undermined by frustrating exploration and combat that takes too long to properly shine."



https://www.eurogamer.net/skibidi-toilet-has-made-its-way-to-borderlands-4-just-to-spite-its-narrative-director

item.title: Monster Hunter Wilds collaboration with Final Fantasy 14 will let you paint pictures as a Pictomancer, plus new Elder Dragon scheduled for December
item.content:encoded:
Technical improvements also on the way.

The Monster Hunter Wilds collaboration with Final Fantasy 14 arrives next week as part of the game's third free update, and will include Jobs from the MMORPG.

Specifically, players will be able to take the role of a Pictomancer and Dark Knight, with special abilities available depending on equipped weapons. The Pictomancer is a mage who wields magic through painting, while the Dark Knight wields a greatsword infused with darkness.

The collaboration was first revealed at Gamescom's Opening Night Live, but now we know it'll be available from 29th September.

The collaboration will also include a new quest to defeat Omega Planetes, which will include unique battle mechanics.

Other Final Fantasy elements will include Palico and Seikrat equipment, pendants and gestures, and outfits.

Alongside the collaboration, the third update will also include Arch-tempered Nu Udra, new quest completion animations, and more. A Halloween-themed event called Dreamspell is also on the way.

Producer Ryozo Tsujimoto also thanked the community for their feedback, alluding to criticism of the game's technical performance. He stated the team is "working on implementing improvements and adjustments".

The fourth free update for Monster Hunter Wilds will include "various improvements", as well as more endgame content and a brand new monster called Gogmazios. It'll be available in December.

Players have been complaining about the game since its release, with Capcom revising its roadmap back in July.



https://www.eurogamer.net/monster-hunter-wilds-collaboration-with-final-fantasy-14-will-let-you-paint-pictures-as-a-pictomancer-plus-new-elder-dragon-scheduled-for-december
